Genomic2DTK 0.1.0

    GetQuantif

    GetQuantif.Rd

    Compute a function on each matrix that compose a matrices list.

    Usage

    GetQuantif(
  matrices.lst,
  area.fun = "center",
  operation.fun = "mean_rm0",
  name.chr = NULL
)

    Arguments

    matrices.lst

    <List[matrix]> : A matrices list.

    area.fun

    <character or function> : A character or function thaht alow an extraction of an area on each matrix that compose the matrices lits (Default "center").

    • "mean_rm0" : apply a mean after replace 0 with NA

    • "median_rm0" : apply a median after replace 0 with NA

    • "sum_rm0" : apply a sum after replace 0 with NA

    • "median" : apply a median

    • "sum" : apply a sum

    • "mean" or other character : apply a mean

    operation.fun

    <character or function> : A character or function to applt on the extracted area of each matrix that compose the matrices lits (Default "mean_rm0").

    • "C" or "CENTER" : Take the area of interaction between anchor and bait.

    • "UL" or "UPPER_LEFT" : Take the area of interaction in the uppper left square

    • "UR" or "UPPER_RIGHT" : Take the area of interaction in the uppper right square

    • "BL" or "BOTTOM_LEFT" : Take the area of interaction in the bottom left square

    • "BR" or "BOTTOM_RIGHT" : Take the area of interaction in the bottom right square

    • "U" or "UPPER" : Take the area of interaction in above the center area

    • "B" or "BOTTOM" : Take the area of interaction in below the center area

    • "L" or "LEFT" : Take the area of interaction in the left of the center area

    • "R" or "RIGHT" : Take the area of interaction in the right of the center area

    • "D" or "DONUT" : Take the area of interaction that surround the center area

    name.chr

    <character> : The name of a column in GInteraction attributes of matrices.lst used as named in the output (Default NULL).

    Value

    A GRange object.

    On this page
